score_details.score_summary: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE earns 38/100 due to moderate alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: According to many scholars, institutions such as Zaytuna College meet the requirements for zakat eligibility. However, we have chosen to limit the zakat funds only to the total cost of education for zakat eligible students and not for any other institutional expenditures. We take this sacred trust very seriously, so if you choose to give a portion of your zakat to Zaytuna College, we will do our utmost, God willing, to ensure its most judicious and shariah compliant use. Additionally, Zaytuna College has a dedicated 'Zakat Fund' which 'serves as the basis of our financial aid program and is utilized to cover the total cost of educating a zakat-eligible student.' (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEbFwJHL4ixUT5fJ1_qUFj5QXmQ0s5B7pVE4rzXX60w_bhCPTy5XuxXeTr8wou_CW7HH6O__J9-DZRvXYYGt4fuahOOp4-JmVBvqchhbFkIEF3e1LnNHmYKo34dWkk0dw==)

Financial records indicate a program expense ratio of 56.0% and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
Zaytuna College offers a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts.
The college maintains accreditation status for its degree programs.
The institution aims to prepare professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders.
The curriculum is grounded in the Islamic scholarly tradition.
The college provides a Summer Arabic Intensive program.
Zaytuna College is a zakat-eligible organization.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The score reflects a highly stable financial position and unique educational niche, tempered by a moderate program expense ratio and the capacity-building nature of its impact.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 56.0% is lower than industry benchmarks for direct service

dimension_explanations.alignment: Zaytuna College shows medium alignment for donors interested in global education and Islamic scholarship, offering a clear zakat-eligible pathway for contributions [8]. The institution addresses a specific urgency in providing accredited Islamic higher education within a Western context [5][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The college focuses on capacity building through higher education, reporting a total revenue of $18,359,667 to support its academic infrastructure [1][2]. While it maintains a program expense ratio of 56.0%, its impact is primarily measured through the long-term influence of its graduates rather than immediate direct services [3][7].

baseline_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College is the first accredited Muslim liberal arts college in the United States, dedicated to grounding students in both Islamic and Western scholarly traditions.
strengths: High financial stability with 33.6 months of working capital
Strong fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised
Maintains formal accreditation for its unique liberal arts curriculum
baseline_narrative.summary: Located in Berkeley, California, Zaytuna College offers specialized degree programs including a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts [3][4]. The institution operates as a zakat-eligible entity, focusing on the development of morally committed intellectual and spiritual leaders [8].

areas_for_improvement.detail: The <cite id="12">program expense ratio of 56.0%</cite> is notably lower than the <cite id="18">peer program ratio median of 78.4%</cite>.
There is <cite id="19">insufficient data for cost-per-beneficiary calculation</cite>, making it difficult to assess the direct financial efficiency of student outcomes.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The college's accreditation requires significant administrative overhead to maintain rigorous academic standards.
risk_factors: <cite id="11">Excessive working capital</cite> of 33.6 months may suggest capital is not being deployed as quickly as it is raised.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="12">56.0% program expense ratio</cite>, which indicates that nearly 40% of revenue is directed toward administrative and fundraising costs.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023 Form 990; Accreditation from 2025 catalog
confidence.notes: Strong data availability for financials and accreditation; impact data is qualitative.

alignment.explanation: The college has a <cite id="22">medium Muslim donor fit</cite> as a <cite id="23">zakat-eligible</cite> institution serving the <cite id="24">Education Global</cite> cause area.

credibility.explanation: Zaytuna is highly credible due to its <cite id="14">WASC accreditation</cite> and <cite id="17">Candid Gold Seal</cite>. Governance is supported by an <cite id="20">independent board of 12 members</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility could be enhanced by <cite id="21">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with a defined causal pathway for its educational model.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by <cite id="2">capacity building</cite> through higher education, though the <cite id="12">program expense ratio of 56.0%</cite> suggests room for more direct spending on student services.
impact.improvement: The college should <cite id="19">track and report beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a more rigorous cost-per-student analysis.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct educational service provider; not a grantmaking foundation.

rich_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College is the first accredited Muslim liberal arts college in the United States, dedicated to grounding students in both Islamic and Western scholarly traditions.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in the long-term intellectual infrastructure of the American Muslim community through an accredited academic institution.
donor_motivations: Value the synthesis of Islamic and Western scholarly traditions
Want to support the first accredited Muslim college in the US
Prefer supporting established institutions with high financial stability
Seek to fulfill zakat through educational scholarships
giving_considerations: Donations support a high-overhead academic environment
The college maintains very high cash reserves
Impact is measured in long-term leadership development rather than immediate relief
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-efficiency direct humanitarian relief or those who prefer organizations with low administrative overhead.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified accreditation and program delivery, but lacks specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Zaytuna creates impact by educating leaders grounded in Islamic and Western traditions to serve as intellectual and spiritual guides.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Accreditation ensures that the educational degrees provided have recognized value in the broader professional and academic world.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the college has high reserves, its <cite id="16">19.7% revenue growth</cite> suggests it is successfully scaling its endowment and campus footprint.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Zaytuna is the only <cite id="2">fully accredited Muslim liberal arts college</cite> in its peer group, which includes <cite id="25">Darul Qasim</cite> and <cite id="26">Bayan Islamic Graduate School</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Smaller scale, focused on traditional religious services
similar_organizations.name: Darul Qasim

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses specifically on graduate-level Islamic chaplaincy and leadership
similar_organizations.name: Bayan Islamic Graduate School

similar_organizations.differentiator: Smaller organization with a narrower focus on imam training

strengths.detail: The college maintains <cite id="11">33.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer against economic volatility.
Zaytuna demonstrates strong fiscal discipline in development, spending only <cite id="13">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in donations.
The institution has secured and maintained <cite id="14">WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC)</cite> accreditation, validating its academic rigor.

strengths_deep_dive: Zaytuna College's primary strength lies in its institutional maturity and financial health. Since its founding in <cite id="1">2009</cite>, it has transitioned from a startup to an established <cite id="2">accredited institution</cite>. Financially, the college is highly resilient, holding <cite id="15">$50,952,913 in total assets</cite> against relatively low liabilities. This stability is bolstered by a <cite id="16">3-year revenue CAGR of 19.7%</cite>, indicating consistent donor support and growth. Furthermore, the college holds a <cite id="17">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a commitment to public disclosure of its governance and mission.
rich_narrative.summary: Zaytuna College, established in <cite id="1">2009</cite> and located in Berkeley, California, serves as the first <cite id="2">accredited Muslim liberal arts college</cite> in the United States. The institution aims to prepare <cite id="3">morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders</cite> by integrating Islamic scholarly traditions with Western liberal arts. The college reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $18,359,667</cite> in 2023, with a significant portion of its income derived from <cite id="5">$15,266,326 in contributions</cite>. Zaytuna maintains a unique academic profile, offering a <cite id="6">BA in Liberal and Islamic Studies</cite> and an <cite id="7">MA in Islamic Texts</cite>, alongside community-facing initiatives like the <cite id="8">12000 Strong</cite> program and <cite id="9">Online Courses</cite>. While the college demonstrates <cite id="10">high financial stability</cite> with <cite id="11">33.6 months of working capital</cite>, its <cite id="12">program expense ratio of 56.0%</cite> remains below the median for its peer group in the global education sector.
